snippet: Even though Yasuo Matsui lived in New York for four decades and designed several New York buildings, the architect was among the Japanese detained during World War II.
abstract: Christopher Gray Streetscapes column on architect Yasuo Matsui, who lived in New York City for four decades and designed several of its iconic buildings; notes that Matsui was among the Japanese detained during World War II.
lead_paragraph: Even though Yasuo Matsui lived in New York for four decades and designed several New York buildings, the architect was among the Japanese detained during World War II.

headline.print_headline: A Towering Career; A Collision With War
headline.seo: Streetscapes - Yasuo Matsui: A Career Collides With War
headline.main: A Towering Career; a Collision With War
